name: Gluten Free Danish
author: Melissa R.
summary: My husband says these are the closest thing to 'real' Danish he has had since going gluten-free five years ago. We like raspberry jam, but you could also try pie filling in the middles.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons milk, or more as needed
directions: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Combine the pancake mix, butter, and sugar; mix until crumbly
Stir in 2/3 cup milk and 1/2 teaspoon almond extract and mix until fully incorporated
Drop the dough by rounded tablespoons onto the baking sheet, spacing the dough about 2 inches apart
With the back of a teaspoon, make a shallow indentation in the center of each dough ball
Fill the centers with a teaspoon of jam
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 10 to 12 minutes
Combine the confectioners' sugar, 3 tablespoons of milk, vanilla extract, and 1/4 teaspoon almond extract and mix until smooth
Drizzle the glaze over the Danish
